t: For the choir director. A Psalm of David.
O*pn Lord,*s in Your strength the king will be glad, And*ln in Your salvation how greatly he will rejoice!
You*ln have given him his heartâ€™s desire, And*ln You have not withheld the request of his lips. Selah.
For*ln You meet him with the blessings of good things; You*ln set a crown of fine gold on his head.
He*ln asked life of You, You*ln gave it to him, Length*ln of days forever and ever.
His*ln glory is great through Your salvation, Splendor*ln and majesty You place upon him.
For*ln You make him most blessed forever; You*ln make him joyful with gladness in Your presence.
For*ln the king trusts in the Lord,*s And*ln through the lovingkindness of the Most High he will not be shaken.
Your*ln hand will find out all your enemies; Your*ln right hand will find out those who hate you.
You*ln will make them as a fiery oven in the time of your anger; The*ln Lord*s will swallow them up in His wrath, And*ln fire will devour them.
Their*ln offspring You will destroy from the earth, And*ln their descendants from among the sons of men.
Though*ln they intended evil against You And*iln devised a plot, They*ln will not succeed.
For*ln You will make them turn their back; You*ln will aim with Your bowstrings at their faces.
Be*ln exalted, O Lord,*s in Your strength; We*ln will sing and praise Your power.
